page.title: 04ECOLOGY AND THE FARMER
page.content: The farmer of today lives and works in an environment whereby he not only has to produce crops but, also, due to increasing concern over the countryside, think and plan his farm to accommodate the different aspects of wildlife for{conservation.}Two decades ago hedges, trees and dykes were removed, wholesale in some areas, to enlarge field size for optimum workability. Now we have to replace hedges or create habitat such as spinnies and copses. This all takes up valuable land but, on every farm, there are places where this can be done. On my own farm we have planted about 800 trees over 3 years and allowed hedges to grow up to about 2.2 metres high and 1.5 metres wide giving an ideal habitat for a multitude of wildlife.
